channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15508] Add command for exporting snapshot in hbase command script
item.description:
Users of the hbase command script can now use the 'hbase snapshot export’ command. This replaces the need to type the full class name of 'org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.ExportSnapshot'
In addition to adding command 'snapshot export', we are also grouping snapshot related commands together as subcommands under 'hbase snapshot'.
item.summary: Add command for exporting snapshot in hbase command script

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Patch files for different branches.
for compatibility I think we have to keep "snapshotinfo", at least in branch-1
I see. So that users could do both "snapshot info" as well as "snapshotinfo" at the same time?
yeah, just to avoid to break scripts that users of the current 1.x may have around
That make sense. Would update HBASE-15508-branch-1.1-and-1.2.patch.

In the patch, I would like to add the following warning message to stderr under 'snapshotinfo' command so users know where we are going:

'hbase snapshotinfo' is deprecated and will not be available in HBase 2. Please use 'hbase snapshot info' instead.

Do you think it's a good idea?
yeah, that sounds great
New patch updated.

-1 overall

LGTM

Any evidience it works? i.e. bring up patched shell and try the commands?

I did a test run, and looks ok to me. going to commit it.

$ hbase snapshot 

Usage: hbase [<options>] snapshot <subcommand> [<args>]

Options:

  --config DIR     Configuration direction to use. Default: ./conf

  --hosts HOSTS    Override the list in 'regionservers' file

  --auth-as-server Authenticate to ZooKeeper using servers configuration



Subcommands:

  create          Create a new snapshot of a table

  info            Tool for dumping snapshot information

  export          Export an existing snapshot


$ hbase snapshot create

2016-03-23 10:36:10,332 ERROR [main] util.AbstractHBaseTool: Required option -name is missing

2016-03-23 10:36:10,333 ERROR [main] util.AbstractHBaseTool: Required option -table is missing

usage: bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.CreateSnapshot <options>

Options:

 -h,--help                  Show usage

 -n,--name <arg>            The name of the created snapshot

 -s,--snapshot_type <arg>   Snapshot Type. FLUSH is default. Posible values are [DISABLED, FLUSH, SKIPFLUSH]

 -t,--table <arg>           The name of the table


$ hbase snapshot info

Missing snapshot name!

Usage: bin/hbase snapshot info [options]

 where [options] are:

...


$ hbase snapshot export

Snapshot name not provided.

Usage: bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.ExportSnapshot [options]

...

This breaks operational compatibility for 1.1.z and 1.2.z because the command "hbase snapshot" goes from creating a snapshot to outputting usage information for the new sub-commands.

Anyone opposed to just reverting and keeping it as new in 1.3?
didn't notice the "snapshot" command to take a snapshot. just snapshotinfo. sounds good to me to revert.
reverted from branch-1.1 and branch-1.2

Does the change you made mean the patch applies to versions 1.3 onwards?

Ah.. Thank you for pointing this out. Agree it was going to break operational compatibility and should be reverted. I was wondering if you have some recommendation as how I could've better handle this for branch 1.1.z and 1.2.z, if possible?

Does the change you made mean the patch applies to versions 1.3 onwards?

Yes, the current fixVersion(s) on the jira are correct. This should be in 1.3+

Ah.. Thank you for pointing this out. Agree it was going to break operational compatibility and should be reverted. I was wondering if you have some recommendation as how I could've better handle this for branch 1.1.z and 1.2.z, if possible?

In this case, I would just stick with keeping this in the next minor release onward since it's effectively new functionality. If folks wanted it in a patch release, you'd need to only add new commands.
